column6: Causes certain kinds of memory read-modify-write instructions to occur atomically
Repeats a string operation (INS, MOVS, OUTS, LODS,and STOS) until the rCX register equals 0.
Repeats a compare-string or scan-string operation (CMPSx and SCASx) until the rCX register equals 0 or the zero flag (ZF) is cleared to 0.
Repeats a compare-string or scan-string operation (CMPSx and SCASx) until the rCX register equals 0 or the zero flag (ZF) is set to 1
Forces use of the current CS segment for memory operands.
Forces use of the current SS segment for memory operands.
Forces use of the current DS segment for memory operands.
Forces use of the current ES segment for memory operands.
Forces use of the current FS segment for memory operands.
Forces use of the current GS segment for memory operands.
Changes the default operand size of a memory or register operand, as shown in Table 1-2 on page 8. (AMD)
Changes the default address size of a memory operand, as shown in Table 1-3 on page 9. (AMD)
